fields.description:
When going through the setup wizard, someone who has existing data can lose data ([and has|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-5771?page=comments#action_50233]) by choosing the "Create Empty Database" option. 

A warning prompt if any existing data is found may prevent this from happening to anyone else.
fields.summary: Add warning to Setup Wizard's "Create Empty Database" when there's existing data
Allow cntrl click for searching multiple locations

fields.description:
Since I'm in QA, I recently have been using IE7 Beta to anticipate issues with our site that may come up after its release.  Your product Confluence has a number of these.

Even basic operations such as a Save of a new web page throw Runtime errors.  The product is mostly usable in IE7 anyway, but the errors are intrusive and frequent.

Probably unrelated to these, the attachment shows a horrible error that occurred when I was trying to create my first page with your project.  What a message!  I think we should enter it in the error code hall of flame!
fields.summary: Many, many javascript errors in IE7 Beta2
Make sure Change Comment is shown in RSS view.
Headings should produce unique anchors so that headings with identical text can still be referred to

fields.description:
Jonathan: 
Both Dan and I have run into a wall getting the WebUI plugins to work
I haven't been able to get them to properly pick up the text value of the I18n key, it always prints the value.
I've tried definiing the I18n resource a couple of different ways, and putting the prop file a couple of different places
the only thing that worked was putting the key/value inside one of the existing confluence prop files.
which obviously isn't a real solution

Charles:
Yeah, I think that's known-broken. Same reason that uploaded language packs don't work at the moment - we have to hack deep in the bowels of webwork to fix it.
fields.summary: WebUI plugins are unable to properly display the I18N-value of the link name

fields.description:
After  logging in the user is directed to http://wiki.cci.edu.au/confluencehomepage.action instead of http://wiki.cci.edu.au/confluence/homepage.action. The address is missing the forward slash. 

We've checked the configuration of this instance. It is same as the previous installation. After checking the login behaviour in different browsers, the issue seems to be a bug in confluence login mechanism. The user is logged in while the login page still appears in IE 7. In Firefox it displays the error message "Not Found The requested URL /confluencehomepage.action was not found on this server."  but only the first time the user logs in. After that the user can log in without any problems.
fields.summary: CLONE -Page not found on Login: slash missing from returned url

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1)  Create a new page.
2)  Edit in the WYSIWIF editor
3)  Create a link (window pops up)
4)  Search for a term with multiple pages of results
5)  Click on the "Next>>>" link or on any of the other page numbers.

The name of the new page SHOULD be Link Properties and there should be Link and Alias text boxes, but instead, the title is "Choose a Page" and the text boxes are gone.  The incorrect page looks like the page when you add a link from the WikiMarkup tab.
fields.summary: Error when navigating off first page of search results while adding a link

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6289]. {panel} (Yes, I have a fetish for getting the HTML produced by Confluence to look ever closer to XML) When the gallery plugin is used, it produces links such as Clown It should really be escaping the & entity to Clown You can see this in action at - http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fdocs.codehaus.org%2Fdisplay%2FCargo%2FHome A description is shown at http://www.htmlhelp.com/tools/validator/problems.html#amp No hurry on this of course; it's just requires another regular expression in the stew. Cheers, Ben

fields.description:
. setup of the standard environment with integrated Tomcat and database, but modify setenv.bat to use -Xms512 for more memory 
2. watch the "Demonstration Space" with the picture of Sydney's harbour 
3. make a full backup incl. attachments to the default backup folder and additionally copy the zip-file into the folder "restore" 
4. make a space backup as XML via "browse space/advanced/space export" into the folder "restore" 
5. remove "Demonstration Space" via "browse space/space admin" 
6. restore "Demonstration Space" via "administration/backup & restore" by using "restore a backup from the filesystem": 
    select the ds-TIMESTAMP.zip-file and click on "restore" (build index = enabled) 
7. System-Response = Completed 100%, therefore switch to the dashboard, click on "Demonstration Space" and recognize the missing harbour picture: 
    NO ATTACHMENTS ARE RESTORED CORRECTLY 

8. restore the full backup: everything works fine as expected (attachments are there again) 

9. repeat steps 5 to 7 with the same failure result (reproducable) 

Please find enclosed the log file as attachment.
fields.summary: Importing post-2.2 space export does not correctly import attachments

fields.description: I can't Add Cvs Module
fields.summary: Can't Add Cvs Module

fields.description:
When viewing a page with embedded Flash movies over HTTPS IE clients get a security popup "This page contains both secure and nonsecure items".

All it takes to fix this is to change the object codebase from:

codebase='http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,0,0'

to:

codebase='https://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,0,0'
fields.summary: Pages served over HTTPS that embed Flash movies display a security warning on IE

fields.description:
Greetings,
I upgraded Confluence from 1.4 to 2.2 about two weeks ago. Since then there has been a problem: About every 24hrs, Confluence will exhibit a problem with loading the appropriate CSS sheets. This will display an html page sans any style sheets. The only way to get this resolved (until the next 24hrs) is to restart the Resin application which in turn restarts both Confluence and Jira - /usr/share/resin/webapps/(Confluence)(Jira)

Configuration details:
I have Jira 3.6.1 and Confluence 2.2 running as webapps under Resin 2.1.16. I recently upgraded from Confluence 1.4 where this issue was not present.
System information:
Java startup variables: args="-J-Xms256m -Xmx1g -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Djava.awt.headless=true -Dorg.apache.commons.logging.simplelog
.defaultlog=info"
Java Version 1.5.0_06
Java Vendor Sun Microsystems Inc.
JVM Version 1.0
JVM Vendor Sun Microsystems Inc.
JVM Implementation Version 1.5.0_06-b05
Java Runtime Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition
Java VM Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM
User Timezone US/Pacific
Operating System Linux 2.6.5-7.97-smp
OS Architecture amd64
Filesystem Encoding UTF-8

Java VM Memory Statistics
Total Memory 411 MB
Free Memory 212 MB
Used Memory 199 MB
Memory Graph
[Used Memory ( 48 %)] [Free Memory ( 52 %)]
52 % Free

Runtime Information
Database Dialect bucket.dialect.MySQLDialect
Database Connection URL jdbc:mysql://localhost/confluence?autoReconnect=true
Database Driver Name com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
Database Driver Version 3.1
Application Server Resin/2.1.16
Servlet Version 2.3
Confluence Home /var/confluence-conf
Uptime 29 minutes, 28 seconds
Version 2.2
Build Number 512

So far it was suggested from Confluence support to roll back any  themes I may have enabled. However, I am using all defualt themes and layouts:

Main Layout
Defines the generic header and footer for all pages in Confluence.
Edit | Reset Default | View Default
Global Layout
Defines the appearance of the dashboard and a users profile.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Popup Layout
Popup windows such as the user history popup are displayed using this layout.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Printable Layout
The layout used to display the page when the user clicks the "printable" icon in the top-right of the page.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Content Layouts

Content layouts control the appearance of content such as pages and news items: they don't change the way the pages themselves are displayed, but they allow you to alter the way the surrounding comments or attachments are shown.
Decorator Operations
Space Layout
Controls how a space is displayed.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Page Layout
Controls how a page is displayed.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Mail Layout
Controls how mail is displayed.
< default > | Create custom | View Default
Blog Post Layout
Controls how a blog post is displayed.
< default > | Create custom | View Default

This issue is reproduceable about every 24 hours regardless of the browser/version being used. I will get a screenshot the next time it happens if that would help. I have also attached two log files that I hope wil help. 

Thanks in advance and let me know if you require additional information.

-Jesse
fields.summary: Strange CSS behavior in Confluence 2.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6282].
  {panel}

I'd like the browse-space tree to have drag and drop. This would reduce organizing a bunch of pages to a few seconds!

Potential implementations:
* http://www.scbr.com/docs/products/dhtmlxTree/index.shtml
* http://www.xs4all.nl/~peterned/blog/sorttree.html
* http://script.aculo.us/playground/test/functional/sortable_tree_test.html

P.S. I'd still like to the "expand all nodes" feature to come back -- and have the nodes "remember" if they were previously opened.
fields.summary: Drag n Drop Page Tree Client Magic

fields.description:
CamelCase is being applied in areas that most likely should never have it applied.  When I say applied, I mean linked.

Areas to automaticaly "no-link" CamelCase:
* Headings
* Paths ... like c:\MyPath\ThisIsFun or /MyPath/ThisIsFun
* File names ... like ThisIsFun.xml
fields.summary: CamelCase should not apply in certain circumstances

fields.description:
1. THE ENCODING TEST /admin/encodingtest.action PERFORMS SUCCESSFULLY AT ALL PARTS!

Postgres database has UTF-8 encoding, Tomcat connector configured with URIEncoding=UTF-8, Confluence encoding is UTF-8.

2. Precondition. Some page (P1) has some CAPITAL NATIONAL (russian, in my case) CHARACTERS in its title.

3. Problem 1.
The error "Parent Page <P1> not exists" occurs when creating child page (P2).

4. Problem 2
The attachement link [title|^filename.txt] shows as error (red) on page P1.

5. Check for problems reason
After removing all CAPITAL NATIONAL CHARACTERS from page title, both problems  disappears. But it' is not acceptable solution.

6. Pure empty standalone version with hsql works normal.
fields.summary: Page parents and attachement links does not work with national characters and PostgreSQL.

During Confluence setup, Confluence calls DefaultUserAccessor.getGroupCreateIfNecessary(). If LDAP is enabled and the LDAP provider throws an exception, the setup process continues unaffected.

Exceptions seem to be ignored throughout the admin user creation process. This needs to be fixed so the setup process aborts if the admin user can't be created.

fields.description:
Replication steps:

1. Create page "A" with any text.
2. Create page "B" as a child of page "A" (ie click "Add Page" link on page "A")
3. Make the text of page B -"My parent is page [A]."
4. Hit "Preview"
5. Link is red as if an error link
6. Save page and the link works fine.

If you edit the page again, or change it's parent the link renders fine. It's only on the initial creation, in preview mode, that a link to the parent doesn't seem to render.

fields.description:
We'd like to include plugins in the default confluence distribution (particularly the Conf Repo Client) that are upgradeable,  just like user-installable plugins.

The repo client needs to be capable of upgrading itself, which means that it can't be a static plugin. However, all current bundled plugins are static and can't be replaced. So I created a new plugin loader that looks in the {$conf-install-dir}/bundled-plugins directory and dynamically loads plugins from there as well. Perfect!

Next, however, imagine that you've installed your own copy of the repo-client in {$conf-home}/plugins. If you upgrade to Confluence 2.3 containing the bundled copy, the two plugins are going to conflict.

To solve that problem, we have to be able to compare two plugins from different plugin-loaders and choose the more recent. I implemented a compareTo() method on the Plugin class that will attempt to get the plugin's version and determine which is the more recent. It expects standard x.x.x format version. It does a little bit of cleanup (removing spaces, etc.) to try to ensure an accurate comparison.

So now when we find a duplicate plugin key, we check to see if the conflicting plugin is newer than the one we have. If it is, we unload the current plugin and load the new one. If it is the same version or older, we do nothing. If we can't get a valid version (e.g., the format is wrong) we leave the plugin we've already loaded in place.

On the other hand, we always want to get back to a baseline version of Confluence - identical to what shipped from Atlassian. So that means when we load a user-installed verison of a bundled plugin, we don't want to remove the bundled version. So I made sure that my new bundled-plugins plugin loader doesn't actually delete any files. That way, if you ever get into trouble, you can clear your {{{$conf-home}/plugins}) and get back to the original state.

After talking over the design of the bundled-plugins feature with Mike, he pointed out that our simple "look in this directory" plan wouldn't work when deploying in an un-exploded .war. So we need to bundle the zips and then actually extract them into $confluence-home/bundled-plugins.. So I build a step into ConfluencePluginManager that will, on init:

# check for the presence of an atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip
# check for the presence of $confluence-home/bundled-plugins.
# if different, replace the contents of $confluence-home/bundled-plugins with the contents of atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip.

So, that way, we can always ensure that the default set of plugins will be there, but we don't end up copy-ing them out freshly on each startup, which would be wasteful. If a user wants to upgrade a bundled-plugin, he will copy a new version into $confluence-home/bundled-plugins, and the newer version will override the default until uninstalled. If uninstalled, the plugin manager will pick up the older, bundled version.

If the user has a custom-installed version of a bundled plugin, and then we release a newer version as part of a Confluence upgrade, that version will be the one that runs.
fields.summary: Create new plugin bundling system that will allow for user upgrades

fields.description:
Confluence allows you to configure groups and individual users just about anyway you like at the space level.  However, the "Restrict View" and "Restrict Edit" options at the page level are, well, too restrictive.  

You can only select 1 user or group for page level access.  This forces the creation of "artificial" groups.  For example, I have a group for my developers wilth r/w access to a space and a group for my client with read access to the same space.  We've a situation where 1 individual in the client organization needs r/w access to a few pages in the aforementioned space.  It appears that the only way to accomplish this is to create a new group (my developers + the one individual).  

This is further exacerbaed by the user/group handling.  There's no way to 'copy' an existing group to a new one,si

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6263].
  {panel}

I filed an issue [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-16] about PluginDisableEvent being in the wrong place (it should be fired before, not after the disabling). In addition to this, the PluginEnableEvent (and the appropriate Enable events  below) should be fired during plugin manager initalisation, as if a plugin listens for the PluginEnableEvent regarding itself to perform some init work, that init work is skipped during a conf restart.

The following events added approprately would be very useful:

PluginBeforeEnableEvent
PluginAfterEnableEvent
PluginBeforeDisableEvent
PluginAfterDisableEvent

PluginModuleBeforeEnableEvent
PluginModuleAfterEnableEvent
PluginModuleBeforeDisableEvent
PluginModuleAfterDisableEvent

The plugin module ones should also contain the module key + module complete key in addition to the plugin key (which is in the "name" property(?!) of PluginEvent).
fields.summary: More Plugin Events: Plugin/PluginModuleBefore/AfterEnable/Disable

fields.description:
If the Referer header is 'http://localhost/confluence/homepage.action', and the Confluence base URL is 'http://localhost/confluence/', the original URL gets set to 'homepage.action'. When Seraph's LoginFilter sends its redirect, it does so by just appending the original URL to the context path which never has a trailing slash, so you get a redirect to 'http://localhost/confluencehomepage.action'. Oops.

We need to ensure Original URL always starts with a slash and also make sure that all Seraph redirects check for a leading slash on whatever they attach to the context path.
fields.summary: LoginAction does not generate correct original URL from Referer if base URL ends with a slash

fields.description:
When a page edit is committed and a user is set to watch that page, yet that user does not have a value stored in their user profile for email address, the following error is logged by Confluence.

2006-05-25 15:38:25,683 ERROR [com.opensymphony.xwork.ActionSupport] doSaveEditPageBean An error occured while storing the requested page!
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: user cstivers has null email address for mail notification item with subject Dave Conn: Home (page edited)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.MailNotificationQueueItem.checkUser(MailNotificationQueueItem.java:82)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.MailNotificationQueueItem.<init>(MailNotificationQueueItem.java:56)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.<init>(PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.java:21)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.createFromTemplateFileAndLocation(PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.createFromTemplateFileAndContext(PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.java:99)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.listeners.AbstractNotificationsListener.sendNotification(AbstractNotificationsListener.java:44)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.listeners.AbstractNotificationsListener.sendNotifications(AbstractNotificationsListener.java:66)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.listeners.AbstractNotificationsListener.sendPageNotifications(AbstractNotificationsListener.java:51)
....etc....

The problem is that the page is stored, but the page viewer will see an error message which states "An error has occured" without further information.  The page has been stored correctly, but the editor will NOT know this.  Subsequent edits will then throw an error stating that the editer is working with an outdated page (because the Confluence editor component will be using the version of the page BEFORE the error was thrown, yet the new page was already stored successfully.)
This issue is EASY to work around for us, as we can simple define the "mail" attribute in our LDAP implementation for all users, however, Confluence should be able to gracefully store the page for the editor, while sending an error email to Confluence Administrators that the user WATCHING the page does not have an email address defined.  If this action is too complex, Confluence should at LEAST have the ability to save the page WITHOUT error for the editor, while still logging that an error has occured.

Access to array items in code macro is recognized as undefined page

fields.description:
Macro generation occurs during page load when a connection to the database is held by the session. If an HTTP macro takes a long time to request information from a remote server, the database connection used by the thread is unavailable, and other servlet threads will wait for a connection.

We can counter this in two ways:

1. Create a configuration setting for the HTTP timeout so a system administrator can configure a reasonable timeout for RSS and Jiraissues macro requests. Outbound connections will timeout quicker and return their connections to the pool.

2. Cache negative hits for HTTP-based macros such as Jiraissues and RSS. That is, if the server doesn't respond and we receive an error response, cache the error response and return that for the next half-hour. At the moment we only cache successful results for these macros.

In the long term, we should probably investigate an asynchronous approach to retrieving this information (probably via AJAX), so the database connections are never held unnecessarily. There are accessibility concerns with doing this, however.
fields.summary: Prevent outbound HTTP connections during page rendering monopolising database connections

fields.description: Due to some attachment changes made for 2.2, images on a page exported to Word (in a private space) do not show up. This is because Confluence will now require "Word" to login to view those attachments (when a previous security hole allowed it) accessed through the direct URL, and so the image does not appear. e.g. the following IMG tag embedded in the exported Word (HTML) document links directly to an attachment. Attempting to access this (with the domain pre-pended) will result in the login screen appearing. *Workarounds:* Office Connector (for 3.5.x and previous versions only) The [Office Connector for Confluence|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221] does not have this problem. Instead of selecting Tools > Export to Word, you select Tools > Edit in Word . This will open up the Confluence page in Word, including any images. You can then do whatever you like with the file on your local machine and save changes back to the server if needed. -2. Set A Cookie- -Simply login to Confluence using Internet Explorer and tick "Remember my login on this computer". So long as this cookie is maintained by Internet Explorer (i.e. until you wipe your cookies or click log out), you will be able to successfully view all images when viewing your document in Word. Note that this will be remain effective after you close IE although it will need to be performed after a restart of the server.- *Edit:* Set A Cookie work around does not work. Please use Office Connector instead.
fields.summary: Images in Word export pages do not show up because of login requirement

After checking the login behaviour in different browsers, the issue seems to be a bug in confluence login mechanism. The user is logged in while the login page still appears in IE 7. fields.description:
If the user filter excludes users who are returned as confluence group members, the page listing members of a group is incorrect:

Minor issue: We had to use a ldap attribute to limit the number of users available to confluence (due to our licence limit of 25 users). So our user filter in atlassian-config.xml has confluence=1 in it. Works fine. When we display the users of a specific group, if a member of the group does not have the confluence attribute setted to 1, the user is not displayed but instead the previous user in the list is dupplicated! For example users A and B have access to confluence, but not user C. If I list the membership of a ldap group that has the 3 users in it, I get this in confluence: A B B instead of the excepted A B

fields.description:
steps:
1. click on add page
2. select a template to create page from
3. 'Next'
4. 'insert variables'

results:
- the resulting page shows 'New Page' ungrayed, and indeed I can save the new page without changing the title.

Granted I can do it only once per space, since 'New Page' cannot be reused afterward. Hence the Major rather than Critical priority. I still assigned Major because a bug like this is unacceptable in such key functionality.

Creating a page without using a template behaves as it should: 'New Page' serves exclusively as a placeholder/hint and the user is still forced to enter an actual title before saving.

As an aside, it is somewhat disheartening when essential functionality that was perfectly fine is broken by the introduction of new features/enhancements arguably of much lesser value to the user. I seem to be finding a number of these for some reason.
fields.summary: When creating a page from a template, 'New Page' becomes the default page title and page can be saved without the user entering a title first

fields.description:
Just found in the source-code that ContentEntityObject.getLabels() and LabelUtil.extractLabelsFromLabellings(List labellings) do in fact just the same thing. It's a bit confusing which of them should be used and of course such duplicate code is always a possible target of bugs. So I would suggest e. g. that ContentEntityObject.getLabels() delegates its call to LabelUtil.extractLabelsFromLabellings(List labellings).

Well, of course priority is even much more trivial than trivial ;-) Just wanted to note it.
fields.summary: Unite ContentEntityObject.getLabels() and LabelUtil.extractLabelsFromLabellings(List labellings)
Translation into Danish

fields.description:
Hi to Atlassian,

upon clicking on the thumbnails (or "view as slideshow") generated by the gallery macro a new window pops up and displays the image in full size.

Showing the full size image is very inconvenient for large images, which then spans multiple physical screen sizes. Resiszing the window doesn't resize the image but instead shows only a smaller part of it. Also, the next image opened is shown again at full size, requiring the whole resizing clicking again, but to no avail anyway. Effectively, Confluence can not be adequately used for the display of large images.

Is it possible to either create a new window at most to the current screen size holding an image resized (either by the browser or to a pre-defined size) to that window size?

To my experience this is a standard functionality in other galleries I have seen (Gallery(2), Coppermine, ...). 

There is also a JavaScript script floating around on the 'net to do the resizing and overlay thing in the browser *yuck*: "Lightbox JS" http://www.huddletogether.com/projects/lightbox/.

It would suit Confluence very well to include resizing functionality to enhance usability and make it an even more worthwhile experience.

Thanks for your great product anyway,
Torge Schmidt
fields.summary: Gallery macro should show images resized to screen size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6222].
  {panel}

Dear all,

the gallery macro is great, but it lacks some features that our users mostly requested. Some of them are already listed in CONF-4778. 
The requests below 

- Support a (initial) size parameter for the image slidshow. This should also resize the popup accordingly.

Background: Mostly uploaded are images from digital cameras, 3 Megapixels and up. Those images do not fit on the screen, so you have to scroll the image left/right up/down which is annoying. Also, the images (e.g. 1-3 Megabytes) are transferred over the Network as a whole, where one could save traffic when the size was smaller. Unfortunately, the users are not that much trained so they could upload resized images (e.g. 800x600) -> The server must do the work.

- Introduce a size combobox in the slideshow

The slideshow could have a combobox where the user selects the image size (e.g. 800x600, 1024x768, original size). Then, the image is scaled down by the server and transmitted. Saves network traffic and each user could select the size that fits on screen.
Optionally, each tumbnail and the slideshow picture could get its own "Save original picture as..." link, so each user can download the original picture easily to get high-quality printouts.

What do you think?

Thanks for considering
Andreas
fields.summary: gallery macro: Support predefined/variable image sizes

fields.description:
Installed confluence standalone 2.2.1 (basic install) without a problem. Following directions at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Adding+LDAP+Integration+To+Confluence to migrate to ldap support. Got to step 5, and see this in my browser:

This will migrate your existing users.

Begin migration.
The configuration for the osuserMigrationBean is missing.

Confirmed that I had correctly followed the steps described in step 3. Nothing odd appears in the log files.
fields.summary: Ldap Integration fails in cookbook, step 5
Provide inline help when creating/updating a space template
Predictive text look up for User and Group management

fields.description: Currently one can only assign permission to remove any and all pages: it's an all-or-nothing proposition. Often I want to give some people the ability to create (and conversely remove) their own pages, but not necessarily the ability to remove other pages in the space. It would therefore be great if there was a way to assign such finer-grained permission to people: "remove own". Maybe it could just be implicit in the "create" permission.
fields.summary: There should be a way to give a user/group permission to remove own pages only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6212].
  {panel}

in v.2.1.4 the Admin Manage Groups would have a number (13)  after the Group name indicating number of members -- a very helpful visual clue on group population.  Now this is not there and each group has to be selected to see membership -- much less useful.

Manage Groups also used to list ALL groups, not only first 10.  Either make it a choice (view x-number per page) or show them all!  How do I know if a group I am looking for is on page 4 or 6??

Ideal would be to be able to sort by name and by number of members.

The page listing issue also applies to the Manage Users listing.  Why on earth is this restricted to a list of 10 users??  
Admin should be able to choose number of users to view, or at least have a "View all Users in One Page" option
fields.summary: Group membership numbers and group listing

fields.summary: Including a slash at the end of the personal space URL does not work.

fields.description:
Two separate standalone installs of Confluence (port 8090, and JIRA (port 8100). Logging in to one invalidates the session for the other app, requiring another login, which then invalidates the other etc.

Identical description and likely-sounding cause was found in Issue CONF-799, indicating that the transient JSESSIONID sookies is the problem. The suggested workaround (select "Remember my login") seems to work, certainly both apps can be logged on in the same browser using that option. Not all corporations allow such use of cookies, however, for security reasons.

It's a bit disappointing that such a basic problem is still in the product nearly 2 years later. Or is their something peculiar about my setup that means I'm the first to hit it since then? Seems unlikely.
fields.summary: Confluence and JIRA logins clash when using standalone installs

fields.description: I started watching two spaces, but then realized that I was getting too much email.  I went to my profile and stopped both of the watches.  However, I still receive notifications from both spaces.
fields.summary: Can't Stop Watches

fields.description:
Edit a document with {attachments:upload=true} in body.  Make a change.  Preview causes "There is a problem communicating with server" pop-up.  
Fails with IE, works ok for Firefox.
Removing the upload=true resolves the problem.
fields.summary: edit preview with {attachments:upload=true} fails with IE
